abstract: Microsoft has won an international standards designation for its open-document format, ending a yearlong battle with software rivals.
snippet: Microsoft has won an international standards designation for its open-document format, ending a yearlong battle with software rivals.
lead_paragraph: Microsoft has won an international standards designation for its open-document format, according to voting results obtained Tuesday, apparently ending a divisive yearlong battle with software rivals before a global standards-setting organization.

headline.main: Reversing Loss, Microsoft Wins Open-Format Designation
headline.print_headline: Reversing Loss, Microsoft Wins Open-Format Designation
